TagsPage.aiCreateDesc: AI generates a professional tag template based on industry features
TagsPage.manualCreateDesc: Build a bespoke taxonomy for your unique business context

TagItem.deleteConfirmDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the tag "{tagName}"?

TagDetails.selectTagToView: Please select a tag to view details
TagDetails.tagDescriptionPlaceholder: Optional. Adding tag descriptions helps AI better understand the application scenarios of tags
TagDetails.aiAutoTaggingEnabled: Enabled, allows AI to recognize this tag
TagDetails.aiAutoTaggingDisabled: Disabled, AI will not recognize this tag
TagDetails.matchingKeywordsTooltip: Add keywords related to this tag to help AI identify this tag more accurately
TagDetails.excludeKeywordsTooltip: Add keywords to exclude. Assets containing these words will not be tagged with this tag
TagDetails.matchingRuleDescription: When asset names, metadata, and folder paths match the above keywords, AI will automatically tag the asset
TagDetails.excludeRuleDescription: When asset names, metadata, and folder paths contain these keywords, even if matching keywords are found, the tag will not be automatically applied

ManualCreateModal.LabelDescription: ‚Üê Specific tags (e.g., product images, top series)

ManualCreateTipsModal.UnderstoodPleaseProvideTheText: Only use the new tag system
ManualCreateTipsModal.ClearExistingTagsKeepOnlyTheNe: Clear existing tags, keep only the newly created ones
ManualCreateTipsModal.RetainExistingTagsAndAddNewTag: Retain existing tags, add new tags to the current system.

ManualCreateTips2Modal.ClearExistingTagsAndUseNewOnes: Clear existing tags and use new ones
ManualCreateTips2Modal.ConfirmToUseTheNewTagSystemOnl: Confirm switching to the new tag system? This will clear your existing tags and all associated assets. This action cannot be undone. Proceed with caution.

AiCreateModal.parseError: The generated tag format is incorrect. Please switch to edit mode to adjust manually

tagTreePrompt.template:
You are an expert in enterprise digital asset tag taxonomies. Based on the following user context, generate a 'tag tree'.
[User Context]
{userContext}

You MUST output strictly in the following format only (no extra explanations, symbols, numbering, blank lines, or additional sections):
# Level 1 Tag
## Level 2 Tag
Tag 1
Tag 2

Rules:
- Output only the tag tree itself. Do NOT include any explanations, hints, examples, Markdown code fences, or backticks.
- Use English for all text. 
- Terms should be professional, mutually exclusive, clear, and geared for practical search. Avoid long sentences.
- Do NOT output empty headings, numbering, colons, brackets, or any explanatory text.
- Do NOT add symbols outside the defined levels, such as em dashes, colons, '- ', or numeric lists.
- Do NOT restate the user context or add a concluding summary.

general.label: General Industry
general.prompt:
Marketing-driven enterprises focus on brand storytelling, content creation, performance advertising, and cross-channel campaigns. Key digital assets include brand visuals, advertising creatives, campaign videos, social media content, promotional materials, and branded templates. Organize assets by marketing objectives: brand awareness, lead generation, conversion optimization, and customer retention.
This system applies to e-commerce, CPG, tech hardware, fashion, and F&B industries prioritizing marketing excellence.

ecommerce.label: E-commerce & Retail
ecommerce.prompt:
E-commerce retailers focus on product merchandising, conversion optimization, marketplace presence, and customer lifecycle marketing. Key digital assets include product photography, lifestyle shots, video demos, marketplace banners, promotional graphics, and customer testimonials. Organize assets by sales funnel stages: product discovery, consideration content, conversion assets, and post-purchase engagement.
This system applies to Amazon sellers, Shopify stores, marketplace vendors, and omnichannel retailers across platforms like eBay, Walmart, and direct-to-consumer brands.

fmcg.label: Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG)
fmcg.prompt: CPG brands focus on shelf appeal, category differentiation, retailer partnerships, and consumer education. Key digital assets include packaging photography, in-use demonstrations, lifestyle imagery, retailer-specific materials, promotional campaigns, and educational content. Organize assets by distribution channels: retail partnerships, consumer-direct campaigns, trade marketing, and brand building initiatives.

beauty.label: Beauty & Cosmetics
beauty.prompt:
Beauty brands focus on product education, trend-driven content, influencer partnerships, and community building. Key digital assets include product photography, before/after transformations, tutorial videos, influencer collaboration content, user-generated reviews, and seasonal campaign materials. Organize assets by marketing funnel stages: awareness campaigns, product education, social proof, and conversion-focused content.
This system applies to skincare, makeup, fragrance, and beauty tools brands managing comprehensive content from product showcase to consumer education.

fashion.label: Fashion & Apparel
fashion.prompt:
Fashion brands focus on seasonal collections, style inspiration, influencer collaborations, and lifestyle positioning. Key digital assets include lookbook photography, runway content, styling videos, influencer partnerships, model shoots, and trend-focused campaigns. Organize assets by content strategy: brand storytelling, product showcases, social commerce, and community engagement.
This system applies to clothing, footwear, accessories, and luxury fashion brands managing visual content from product launches to lifestyle communication.

electronics.label: Consumer Electronics
electronics.prompt:
Tech hardware brands focus on feature demonstrations, performance comparisons, user education, and innovation storytelling. Key digital assets include product photography, demo videos, technical specifications, comparison charts, unboxing content, and user tutorials. Organize assets by customer journey stages: product awareness, feature education, purchase consideration, and user onboarding.
This system applies to smartphones, laptops, smart home devices, and tech accessories managing content from product features to user experience.

automotive.label: Automotive
automotive.prompt:
Automotive brands focus on vehicle showcases, performance demonstrations, safety features, and lifestyle integration. Key digital assets include exterior photography, interior details, test drive footage, safety demonstrations, lifestyle scenarios, and sustainability messaging. Organize assets by purchase journey stages: brand consideration, model comparison, feature highlights, and ownership experience.
This system applies to passenger vehicles, electric vehicles, commercial fleets, and automotive parts managing content from brand awareness to driving experience.

interior.label: Interior Design
interior.prompt:
Interior design firms focus on project showcases, design inspiration, process transparency, and client testimonials. Key digital assets include space photography, design renderings, material samples, process documentation, before/after transformations, and client case studies. Organize assets by project lifecycle: inspiration galleries, design concepts, work-in-progress, and completed showcases.
This system applies to residential design, commercial spaces, hospitality design, and home staging managing visual content from concept to completion.

luxury.label: Luxury Goods
luxury.prompt:
Luxury brands focus on heritage storytelling, craftsmanship excellence, exclusivity positioning, and premium experiences. Key digital assets include artisanal photography, craftsmanship videos, brand heritage content, exclusive collections, celebrity endorsements, and experiential campaigns. Organize assets by brand pillars: heritage storytelling, craftsmanship showcase, exclusivity marketing, and lifestyle positioning.
This system applies to haute couture, fine jewelry, luxury watches, and premium leather goods managing content from artisanal value to cultural significance.

gaming.label: Gaming
gaming.prompt:
Gaming companies focus on community engagement, gameplay showcases, competitive esports, and user-generated content. Key digital assets include game trailers, character artwork, gameplay footage, esports highlights, community content, and live stream materials. Organize assets by engagement strategy: game promotion, community building, competitive content, and player retention.
This system applies to mobile games, PC gaming, console titles, and VR experiences managing content from game marketing to community ecosystem.

jewelry.label: Jewelry
jewelry.prompt:
Jewelry brands focus on craftsmanship storytelling, emotional connections, occasion marketing, and personalization services. Key digital assets include macro photography, craftsmanship videos, lifestyle imagery, customization showcases, emotional storytelling content, and occasion-specific campaigns. Organize assets by emotional messaging: craftsmanship pride, milestone celebrations, personal expression, and gifting occasions.
This system applies to engagement rings, fine jewelry, custom pieces, and fashion jewelry managing content from artisanal craft to emotional significance.

theme-park.label: Theme Parks
theme-park.prompt:
Entertainment venues focus on experience marketing, seasonal events, family engagement, and immersive storytelling. Key digital assets include attraction photography, experience videos, seasonal campaigns, behind-the-scenes content, visitor testimonials, and safety communications. Organize assets by visitor journey: trip planning, on-site experience, seasonal offerings, and memory creation.
This system applies to Disney parks, Universal Studios, regional theme parks, and entertainment complexes managing content from visitor attraction to experience amplification.
